name: Immunity Boosting Green Goddess Soup
description: Recipe video above. A feel-good soup packed full of nutrition created to cure winter colds! While you could switch out the veg with whatever youâ€™ve got, Iâ€™ve tried various combinations and this is my favourite for best flavour so it doesnâ€™t taste like youâ€™re eating a bowl of hot grass.Donâ€™t skip the spices. Doesnâ€™t look like much but it really makes a difference!
recipeIngredient: 1  leek (white part only) or another onion (, diced (Note 1))
3/4 tsp all spice powder ((sub mixed spice))
1  medium potato ((any type), peeled, 1.5 cm cubes )
1 head broccoli (, florets (peel and chop stalk too))
5 cups (tightly packed) kale leaves (, roughly chopped (1 small bunch, Note 5))
2 tbsp sunflower seeds, toasted ((or croutons or other toasted nuts, Note 8))
Cream and/or olive oil for drizzling

recipeInstructions.text: SautÃ© aromatics: Heat oil in a very large pot (6L/qt) over medium high heat. Cook onion, leek, celery, garlic and fennel for 5 minutes until softened.
recipeInstructions.name: SautÃ© aromatics: Heat oil in a very large pot (6L/qt) over medium high heat. Cook onion, leek, celery, garlic and fennel for 5 minutes until softened.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook spices: Add all spice and cumin, and cook for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook spices: Add all spice and cumin, and cook for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add water, potatoes, broccoli, salt and pepper. Stir, bring to simmer, and simmer for 7 minutes (no lid) until the broccoli is tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Add water, potatoes, broccoli, salt and pepper. Stir, bring to simmer, and simmer for 7 minutes (no lid) until the broccoli is tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Add peas: Add peas, simmer for 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add peas: Add peas, simmer for 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Blitz in kale: Remove pot off the stove. Add kale, push it under the liquid, then blitz with a stick blender until mostly smooth. Add spinach, push under the liquid then blitz again until smooth as possible (approx 3 to 5 mins). This will result in a smooth soup but with little green bits in it - I like this for a little texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Blitz in kale: Remove pot off the stove. Add kale, push it under the liquid, then blitz with a stick blender until mostly smooth. Add spinach, push under the liquid then blitz again until smooth as possible (approx 3 to 5 mins). This will result in a smooth soup but with little green bits in it - I like this for a little texture.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve: Stir in cream. Ladle into bowls,  drizzle with extra cream and/or olive oil and finish with a sprinkle of sunflower seeds. Eat and feel great!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve: Stir in cream. Ladle into bowls,  drizzle with extra cream and/or olive oil and finish with a sprinkle of sunflower seeds. Eat and feel great!

review.reviewBody: What a fantastic healthy tasty soup. Big bowl for dinner and the rest in the freezer for quick cuppa soup lunches. Even hubby liked it. Thanks Nagi x

I was looking for a green soup and came across Nagi's recipe.  Although I know kale and broccoli are nutritious, I have not managed to make a delicious and healthy dish with either of them. So, I was intrigued with Nagi's choice of  ingredients. It was very helpful to learn why Nagi selected them. Allspice and Cumin definitely made this soup flavoursome. I was very  pleased with the result. A delicious, nutritious, beautiful green soup. Just what I wanted to make. Thank you, Nagi!

It was the end-of-week fridge cleanout for us and we had 3 HUGE bunches of parsley, and Chinese broccoli left over... so I Googled 'green soup' and I'm so glad this fantastic recipe came up.  We didn't have any kale, celery, potato, or cream, so I added 60 grams of butter instead, and finished it off with sesame oil, yogurt, and chili flakes... and it was still delicious!  Even our 19-year-old cat loved it!?! (Although no chili was used for him).  Next time I'll follow the recipe.  Many thanks for such a wonderful website â€“ there are so many recipes on here I love. x

Another delicious dish, Nagi and truly guilt-free. I did add two massel chicken stock cubes as I kept tasting the liquid and I personally wanted a bit more flavour and depth to the soup. We loved it and hubby said "You can keep this on the rotation". Delicious with some salted cashews and macadamias as a crunchy topping!

This is a super tasty and satisfying soup I like to keep on hand in the freezer. Great to have with a toastie too...

I add a little bit of mint also... delicious
Yes. Above the recipe Nagi has written that the soup can be frozen for 3 months and can be reheated in the microwave.
Quite good and doesnâ€™t taste of grass even though the colour implies it should! Iâ€™m going to enjoy this very much for breakfast- a healthy start to my day ðŸ˜Š

Absolutely delicious! Followed the recipe to the letter and the result was outstanding. Such a beautiful balance of flavours and I felt super virtuous demolishing it. Will be high on rotation this winter. Thank you ðŸ’›
Wow, what a great recipe, everything went to plan, even used the whole bag of spinach! You need a bit of trust with this one, itâ€™s worth it, I feel better already!
I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this soup! I made it once over the winter but looking forward to making it again before my dental surgery. I'm sure this will bring me some comfort.

keywords: green goddess soup, immunity boosting food
